title: Techno-legal expertise and the datafication of the state: Big data, accountability and the value of a social license with institutional roots
research_description: This article examines how techno-legal risk management is shaping data integration and state datafication through interviews with senior government officials and privacy experts in Australia.
research_results: The study highlights the limitations of techno-legal risk management and the necessity of a social license with institutional roots to ensure accountability in state datafication processes.
future_research: Future research should focus on developing mechanisms for public participation in data governance and the co-production of data-driven futures.
